Class CoreFileUtils

java.lang.Object
org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreFileUtils
public class CoreFileUtils extends Object
Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps IOException into IllegalStateException and creates missing parent directories.

  • Method Details

    • encodeBase64

      public static String encodeBase64(String contentToEncode)
      Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed content that allows to use it in HTML-attributes (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
      Parameters:
      contentToEncode - the text-content to encode
      Returns:
      Base64-encoded content

    • encodeBase64

      public static String encodeBase64(byte[] bytesArr)
      Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed array of bytes that allows to use it in HTML-attributes (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
      Parameters:
      bytesArr - the binary-content to encode
      Returns:
      Base64-encoded content

    • imageFileData64

      public static String imageFileData64(File imageFile)
      Load the content of image-file with, encodes its content Base64-encoder and prepend it with corresponding mime-type prefix in order to use that final value either in HTML-attributes (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
      For more advanced detection it's recommended to use Apache Tika
      Parameters:
      imageFile - a file to load the text of binary content
      Returns:
      a data-string to use in HTML-attributes

    • pathParts

      public static Stream<String> pathParts(Path path)
      Getting the sequence of Path-components as Stream<String>.
      This operation is inversion of standard static methods Path.of(String, String...) or Paths.get(String, String...) - so, following expressions are identical:
          pathParts(Path.of("a/b/c"))
    pathParts(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
    Stream.of("a", "b", "c")
      Parameters:
      path - an instance of Path
      Returns:
      components of Path as Stream<String>

    • pathPartsList

      public static List<String> pathPartsList(Path path)
      Getting the sequence of Path-components as List<String> - so, following expressions are identical:
           pathPartsList(Path.of("a/b/c"))
     pathPartsList(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
     List.of("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns unmodifiable implementation of List
     Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns modifiable instance of ArrayList
      Parameters:
      path - an instance of Path
      Returns:
      components of Path as List<String>

    • pathPartsStr

      public static String pathPartsStr(Path path)
      Joining the stream of path components with File.separator - so, the assertions like following are always correct:
          assertThat(pathPartsStr(Path.of("a/b/c"))).isEqualTo("a/b/c")
      There could be some surprises with un-normalized parts of path, which includes reference to parent directory. Such cases must be handled and tests properly, because the family of methods pathPartsXXX is just a pure representation of path-parts without additional handling them.
      Parameters:
      path - an instance of Path
      Returns:
      the sequence of Path-components joining with File.separator

    • loadFileAsText

      public static String loadFileAsText(String pathToLoadStr)
      The same as loadFileAsText(File), but accept the path to that file as String
      Parameters:
      pathToLoadStr - the path of file to laod as String
      Returns:
      the content of that file as String or null if it's impossible to do

    • loadFileAsText

      public static String loadFileAsText(File fileToLoad)
      Loading the content of file as String (it's allowed to use for text-files only) and throws IllegalStateException if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
      Parameters:
      fileToLoad - file to read the content
      Returns:
      the content of file as String or null if it's impossible to do

    • loadFileAsBytes

      public static byte[] loadFileAsBytes(File fileToLoad)
      Loading the content of file as byte[] and throws IllegalStateException if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
      Parameters:
      fileToLoad - file to read the content
      Returns:
      the content of file as String or null if it's impossible to do

    • loadFileLines

      public static List<String> loadFileLines(Path filePathToLoad)
      Loading the content of file as list of lines, where each line is an element of returning List of String.
      Parameters:
      filePathToLoad - path of file to read the content as lines
      Returns:
      the content of filePathToLoad as List<String>

    • saveFileContent

      public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent)
      Saving the content into the file fileToSave (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated). All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
      Parameters:
      fileToSave - the file to save into
      fileContent - the content to be saved
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)

    • copyFile

      public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile)
      Copy the file sourceFile to the file targetFile and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.

    • removePathSilent

      public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove)
      The same as Files.deleteIfExists(Path), but ignore any kind of IOException.
      Note: For non-empty directory the method removeSilent(File) should be used, because this method will always return false for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
      Parameters:
      pathToRemove - the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
      Returns:
      true if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or false otherwise

    • removeSilent

      public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove)
      Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
      Parameters:
      fileOrDirToRemove - path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
      Returns:
      the number of removed items
